name: Identity on Blockchain
description: Exploring the use of blockchain for self-sovereign identity and decentralized identity management.

cards.title: Introduction to Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI)
cards.description: Understanding how blockchain enables individuals to control their own identity.
cards.bulletpoints: Principles of SSI, traditional identity vs. decentralized identity, real-world applications
cards.summaryText: Contrast centralized identity silos with SSI so you can describe how users own credentials and share them selectively.

cards.title: Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs)
cards.description: Exploring how DIDs provide a foundation for decentralized identity.
cards.bulletpoints: W3C DID standard, DID methods, interoperability challenges
cards.summaryText: Dig into the W3C DID spec and method registries to understand how portable, resolvable identifiers power SSI.

cards.title: Verifiable Credentials & Authentication
cards.description: Understanding how credentials can be issued, verified, and stored in a trustless system.
cards.bulletpoints: Credential issuance models, cryptographic verification, selective disclosure
cards.summaryText: Track how issuers sign verifiable credentials and how holders reveal just enough data for cryptographic verification.
